channel.title: First Baptist Church Muncie Indiana
channel.description: Sermons from First Baptist Church Muncie Indiana
channel.itunes:author: Wade Allen
channel.itunes:subtitle: Sermons from First Baptist Church Muncie Indiana
channel.itunes:summary: This podcast includes sermons from First Baptist Church in Muncie, Indiana.

item.title: David's Dark Days
item.description: As we continue to walk through the story of David, we come to an extended narrative of David’s life just prior to Saul’s death. In desperation, David retreats to the Philistines. It appears that these years are dark da...

item.title: The Story of Abigail
item.description: As we gather in a combined service on this holiday weekend, we will explore the story of Abigail. Betsy Whaley, Vice President Of Programs And Community Collaboration of the Julian Center in Indianapolis, will be preaching.
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen
item.itunes:subtitle: As we gather in a combined service on this holiday weekend, we will explore the story of Abigail. Betsy Whaley, Vice President Of Programs And Community Collaboration of the Julian Center in Indianapolis, will be preaching.
item.itunes:summary: As we gather in a combined service on this holiday weekend, we will explore the story of Abigail. Betsy Whaley, Vice President Of Programs And Community Collaboration of the Julian Center in Indianapolis, will be preaching.

item.title: David's Cave
item.description: As we breeze through three chapters this week, we find Saul on the hunt for David. David has to wake up each morning wondering if his life will end. Yet, David trusts God. He releases his fear and anxiety and allows God to call the shots....
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen
item.itunes:subtitle: As we breeze through three chapters this week, we find Saul on the hunt for David. David has to wake up each morning wondering if his life will end. Yet, David trusts God. He releases his fear and anxiety and allows God to call the shots....

item.title: Valley of Shadows

item.title: After the Giant
item.description: After David killed Goliath, he became famous throughout the land. He, however, was far from becoming king. God has much more to do in his life before he ascended to the throne. In 1 Samuel 18, we walk with David through the time period fo...

item.title: David and Goliath
item.description: This is one of the most familiar stories in all of Scripture. David battles Goliath. Against all odds, a young boy kills an experienced and heavily resourced giant. Join us as we walk through the story together.
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen
item.itunes:subtitle: This is one of the most familiar stories in all of Scripture. David battles Goliath. Against all odds, a young boy kills an experienced and heavily resourced giant. Join us as we walk through the story together.

item.title: He Has Risen
item.description: The resurrected Christ appears first to a small group of women. Their response is appropriate. They worship and carry the news to others. As we come to Resurrection Sunday, may we respond in like ways.
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen
item.itunes:subtitle: The resurrected Christ appears first to a small group of women. Their response is appropriate. They worship and carry the news to others. As we come to Resurrection Sunday, may we respond in like ways.

item.title: Passion Week

item.title: Healing a Broken World
item.description: Jesus' raising Lazarus from the dead is a powerful story. Yet, John’s telling of this event highlights Jesus' purpose in performing this miracle.

item.title: The New Birth
item.description: Jesus encounters a religious leader named Nicodemus in John 3:1-16. Nicodemus is seeking answers. Jesus uses this opportunity to teach of a necessary new birth for those entering the Kingdom of God.
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus encounters a religious leader named Nicodemus in John 3:1-16. Nicodemus is seeking answers. Jesus uses this opportunity to teach of a necessary new birth for those entering the Kingdom of God.

item.title: The Posture of a Pastor
item.description: On February 23, we will meet in one combined worship service (10:45 AM) to ordain Matthew Headley. We will be focusing on 1 Peter 5:1-11 as we affirm Matt’s ministry and God’s calling in his life.
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen

item.title: Examining The Heart

item.title: Salt and Light Living
item.description: In Matthew 5:13-16, Jesus challenges His followers to be salt and light. Through these tangible symbols, Jesus describes the impact that we should make in our world. Through His power, we can change the world in which we live.
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen

item.title: The Beatitudes
item.description: Jesus gathers his disciples on a mountainside to teach them about true happiness. His words must have surprised them; they still catch us off guard today. This well-known passage is often referred to as The Beatitudes...

item.title: John the Baptist
item.description: John the Baptist is one of the most enigmatic characters of the New Testament. On January 19, we will examine this important figure and how he prepared the way for Jesus the Christ.

item.description: Katy Kessler, a student at Ball State, will be sharing about her experience this summer. She is an occupational therapy major who worked in an orphanage in China this summer. She will be sharing her story in worship.
item.itunes:author: Katy Kessler

item.title: The Story of Jonah
item.description: On November 18, we will worship in a combined worship service at 1045 a.m. The children will share a musical about the story of Jonah. We will also reflect the sermon on the call of God in our own lives. Jonah was more concerned about his...

item.title: A Closing Scene
item.description: In the closing scenes of Genesis, we are reminded that God’s story is not over. As Jacob and Joseph pass from the scene, the promise of deliverance looms. As the curtain closes in Genesis, Joseph is embalmed and lies in an Egyptian coffin...
item.itunes:author: Wade Allen

item.title: The Destiny of Jacob's Sons
item.description: In Genesis 49, Jacob calls his sons to his deathbed for a blessing. He speaks powerful words that shape generations to come. His sons, forming the twelve tribes of Israel, will prepare the way for God to enter the world through Jesus. As ...

item.title: Surprise Blessing
item.description: As we near the conclusion of the book of Genesis, Jacob is near death. Joseph and his sons pay a visit to his ailing father. Jacob’s actions of adopting and blessing his grandsons remind us that God often moves in surprising ways. As we l...
